BT dodged a bullet - and , as the executive of Ofcom , Sharon White , admitted , it was for reasons . She said complications with land deals and BT 's pension scheme meant there were \" obstacles \" to a break-up that would delay the process years . It 's the pension scheme that influenced Ofcom 's thinking . BT 's retirement scheme , inherited from its time as a utility , has assets of about \u00c2 \u00a3 40bn and a deficit , on some measures , of about \u00c2 \u00a3 10bn , though BT has poured in billions of pounds in years to redress the gap . sources at the company say that 80 % of the scheme relates to Openreach , the internet infrastructure provider that BT 's rivals would like to see spun off . Separating the pension as part of a break-up would be a headache - and there is the matter of a government guarantee on part of the scheme , something that BT fought in the courts to preserve and won . Creating two pension schemes , with the risk of weakening the resources of one or the , might be a potato , in the pursuit of broadband . BT 's share price reaction might turn out to be . Ms White plans to enforce the separation by introducing a board to run Openreach , but articles of association that will give directors a duty to serve customers of the network as the company 's owners . This holds out an prospect of conflicts to come , and runs to the assumption that in companies , the shareholder is king . It carries an echo of the \" shares \" held by the government in Rolls-Royce and BAE Systems , two companies judged for the defence of the realm . In each case , the share is enshrined by articles of association that give directors and the government powers beyond those enjoyed by company boards . BT 's executive , Gavin Patterson , said he thought he could reach a compromise with Ofcom , but admitted they would need to see the detail of the articles . A Pakistan Telecommunication Authority ( PTA ) official confirmed to the BBC that all internet service providers had been directed to open access to YouTube . The Pakistan Telecommunication Company Ltd posted on its Facebook page on Monday : \" Welcome Back YouTube \" . Pakistan 's ministry of information technology said : \" Google has provided an web process through which requests for blocking access of offending material can be made by the PTA to Google . \" Google / YouTube will restrict access to the said offending material for users within Pakistan . \" , a YouTube spokeswoman said government requests for the removal of content would be granted . \" We have community guidelines , and videos violate those rules , we remove them ,\" she said . \" In addition , we have launched YouTube and we are notified that a video is in that country , we may restrict access to it after a review . \" She said requests by governments for content to be removed would be recorded in YouTube 's Transparency Report . Pakistan 's ban on YouTube was imposed by the Supreme Court in 2012 after the film Innocence of Muslims was uploaded . The video was condemned in the world and sparked protests for its mocking portrayal of the Prophet Muhammad . than a dozen people died in protests in Pakistan . Blasphemy is a crime in Pakistan and can carry the death penalty , although such a sentence has been carried out . The Securities and Futures Commission ( SFC ) said there were \" weaknesses in its procedures , management systems and controls . \" But the regulator said the fine took into account the bank 's action in alerting the authorities once it had discovered the trades , which took place in its emerging markets rates business in 2011 . \" This deserves credit and is the reason today 's sanctions are ones ,\" Mark Steward , the SFC 's head of enforcement , said in a statement . The outcome of that could make a difference to the exchange rate . \" You do have to put all your eggs in one basket - there is the option to hedge your bets and buy half of your dollars and half of them before you go , as you are going to be hit by charges for carrying out two transactions . \" It is shopping buying currency - avoid buying your currency at the minute at the airport . The National Museum of the Royal Navy has started consulting over a proposed move to Portsmouth Historic Dockyard . Campaigners insist it is a memorial to the conflict and \" belongs \" at Eastney . The Yomper statue was created by Philip Jackson , depicting a marine marching across the islands during the 1982 conflict and was unveiled by minister , Lady Thatcher , in 1992 . The National Museum of the Royal Navy ( NMRN ) is planning to relocate the Royal Marines Museum from Eastney to Portsmouth Historic Dockyard as part of a \u00c2 \u00a3 13m lottery funded project and wants to take the statue with it . An petition against moving the statue has attracted than 1,800 signatories , saying it was \" considered as our Falklands War Memorial \" . Sheila Mackie who set it up said : \" The imposing scale of The Yomper needs space and distance to be appreciated , and the visualization of the part in the campaign that the statue represents could be achieved in an space . \" Conservative-led Portsmouth City Council voted to express a \" preference \" that the statue remain it it is . Its motion stated : \" The Yomper statue has graced the seafront for years , serving as a reminder of both the Falklands War and of the Marines' association with Eastney . \" NMRN director Jon Rawlinson said the museum site would have 750,000 visitors a year , compared to 40,000 at the museum . \" He would be seen by people at the dockyard , but of course he was built for [ Eastney ] and is part of . \" He said no decision had been made and it would consider all comments submitted to its consultation .", "It is believed to be the alleged breach of the Terrorism Prevention and Investigation Measures ( TPim ) . The suspect appeared at the Old Bailey accused of failing to contact a monitoring company and report to a police station in January . The Home Office has refused to comment on the case . TPims replaced control orders in January 2012 . The suspect - who can be referred to as BM - was one of nine citizens to a TPim the figures were disclosed in March . The BBC is of anyone who has appeared in court charged with a breach of a TPim . The Home Office said : \" We do comment on cases . The police investigate all breaches of TPims and will prosecute that is . \" Those to a TPim can be ordered to stay at a specified address and report to a police station every day . measures include a ban on contacting individuals , going to areas and places and travelling . Labour has argued that TPims have \" weakened \" protection against terrorism . In March , the reviewer of terror laws , David Anderson , said TPims could prove than control orders because they can be imposed for a period of two years . The court heard that BM is charged with two counts of breaching Section 23 of a TPim order . The allegations are that on 16 January he failed to contact a monitoring company , and on 27 January failed to report to a police station . BM , who has a beard and was dressed for the hearing in a shirt , cannot be named nor have his address published for reasons . The prosecutor Louise Gray asked for a date of 2 July to be set for a plea and case management hearing . The defendant was granted bail although he remains to the restrictions imposed by his TPim . But critics say it could put people out of work as employers might be to afford the wages . The government says it will consult on the issue , but hopes to introduce a wage within two years . Announcing the rate , which was proposed by a panel of advisers , the country 's deputy president Cyril Ramaphosa said : \" We are a step to finalising discussions on the wage . All partners will decide what their take is . \" He said the panel was endorsing the proposed figure as a living wage , but wanted to set a payment for workers . Wages are in the country , the unemployment rate is to 25 % . One employment expert reckoned the figure was a quarter of the amount needed for the upkeep of a household . Prof Chris Malikane of the University of Witwatersrand told a Johannesburg radio station : \" You would need 12,000 rand to sustain a household . \" The African National Congress , South Africa 's ruling party , supported the proposal calling it \" and supported by evidence \" . , the Economic Freedom Fighters , the country 's party , said the plan \" favours business at the expense of workers \" . It called for a wage of 4,500 rand . South Africa faces a downgrade to sub-investment grade by credit ratings agencies next month , with concerns remaining over wage strikes . The SNP topped the vote in the Leith Walk by-election , while Scottish Labour won the seat from the Greens . The by-election was called after Deidre Brock of the SNP and Maggie Chapman of the Scottish Greens stood down . The SNP 's John Lewis Ritchie topped the Leith Walk poll with 2,290 votes . He was elected at stage one in the STV process with a swing in first-preference votes of 7.6 % from Labour . Labour 's Marion Donaldson received 1,623 votes , of Susan Jane Rae of the Scottish Greens on 1,381 . Ms Donaldson was elected at stage 10 of the voting process after preferences had been considered . The by-election was called after Ms Brock stood down she was elected as the SNP MP for Edinburgh North and Leith in May . Ms Chapman , of the Scottish Greens , resigned from her post to concentrate on standing for the Scottish Parliament in May 's election . The turnout for the by-election was 25.1 % . The SNP held the Midlothian West seat on Midlothian Council with a swing of 6.3 % from Labour . The party 's Kelly Parry secured 1,540 votes , of Labour 's Ian Miller on 945 votes . The collection includes letters from Prince Charles and Truman Capote . Sir Patrick , who was known as Paddy , died in 2011 at the age of 96 . He published books on his travels around the world and one of the items in the archive is the surviving notebook from his 1933 trek across Europe . The trek provided the material for his books , ' A Time of Gifts ' , ' Between the Woods and the Water ' and ' The Broken Road ' . Thousands of items which occupy 16 metres of shelving took a year to be catalogued by library staff . Along with letters from century figures they uncovered manuscripts , sketches and what appears to be an John Betjeman poem on the back of an envelope . Sir Patrick spent of World War Two on Crete . During his time he disguised himself as a shepherd to organise guerrilla operations against the Nazis . He led one of the feats of the war in 1944 , capturing the commander of the garrison on Crete . The 1957 film starring Dirk Bogarde ' Ill Met by Moonlight ' was based on the operation . Graham Stewart , the library curator who worked on the archive project , said : \" It is a history of the life of a writer . He was a superstar of his day and his books have , if anything , grown in popularity over the years . \" There has been a lot of interest in the archive and we expect this to increase among Leigh Fermor fans and people in the century . \" The library is working on digitising some of the archive so it can be viewed on its website . They are considering holding exhibitions and displays of the collection so people will be to see it . The archive was given to the library by the John R Murray Charitable Trust . John Murray was Sir Patrick 's publisher and the trust supported the cataloguing of the collection .", "Mr Roache , who is secretary of the union 's Yorkshire region , won 56.7 % of the vote , while the candidate , Paul McCarthy , from the North West region , had 43.3 % . The National Trust is using radar on the 174ft ( 53m ) tower to see under its stone cladding . Ken Evans , from the trust , said the work was \" \" . Built on one of the points of the Blackdown Hills , the landmark was put up as a tribute to the Duke of Wellington 's achievements at the Battle of Waterloo . Mr Evans , the trust 's building surveyor , said the radar study was one of being carried out to \" understand this and monument \" . \" We have been using wind and movement sensors which have surprised us by showing that it does flex in the wind as we expected ,\" he said . \" The radar seeks to identify voids and gaps in the stonework under the surface but should tell us about the materials which were used to build the obelisk . \" Data from the survey will be used to build a computer model of the obelisk and help with a \" repair approach \" .", "The world 's clothing retailer posted earnings of \u20ac 1.26bn (\u00a3 1.1bn ) in the six months to 31 July - 8 % on the period year . Helen Marshall , director of CPRE Oxfordshire , said the West Area Planning Committee \" should under no circumstances be rushed into making decisions \" . \" We are that the planning condition on contamination has been met ,\" she added . \" And the mitigation proposals suggested by the university are to counteract the devastating impact of the buildings on Port Meadow and Oxford 's skyline . \" A trees growing to half the height of the buildings in 15 years' time will meet the brief of ' hiding the buildings in summer and softening their impact in winter ' \" Key issues as the height of the buildings and pollution need to be addressed . \" A University of Oxford spokesman said it had \" thought \" about to mitigate the impact of the buildings . \" Some measures have been put in place , and discussions with the city council and others are ongoing about what we can do ,\" he added . \" The University will be making representations at the hearing in October on the issues raised by the challenge . \" In the meantime , we intend to finish and occupy the buildings by the start of the year in October as planned . \" The city council said month it was carrying out an review into the case . Runways have been damaged , with trenches carved into them and rubble placed along their lengths , Stratfor 's analysis says . Taxiways and aprons - aircraft park - have been sabotaged . About 50,000 security forces , Peshmerga fighters , tribesmen and Shia militiamen , assisted by coalition airstrikes , are involved in a offensive to reclaim Mosul from IS militants . Government forces have retaken dozens of villages and towns surrounding the city and are consolidating gains made in Mosul 's outskirts . The damage to the runways has rendered the airport as an asset for attacking forces , says Stratfor . Airports or runways are a objective for assaults on cities , since control over them can deny or enable capabilities , having a impact on the outcome of battles . , IS militants have ensured there is left for approaching forces to gain by taking the site , Stratfor says . IS employed a tactic at Qayyarah air base , 70km ( 43 miles ) of Mosul . , the trenches dug covered the runway , Stratfor says , and it was restored to service within months of the forces recapturing the base in July . By comparison , Mosul airport 's destruction could be to repair . Mirroring the demolition at Qayyarah , IS fighters have levelled every structure at Mosul airport . Stratfor says that as preventing forces and their allies from using the facilities , the tactic serves to clear the line of sight for IS positions on the edge of the airport . Along with restoring the runways , forces would need to rebuild hangars , warehouses and infrastructure in order to use it as a base . In contrast to the destruction in the area , the images show the city 's sugar factory remains - testimony to its utility to IS . After the jihadists captured Mosul in June 2014 , they continued to operate the factory , says Stratfor , and than a year , executed the plant 's manager she refused to run it for them . , the images show coalition airstrikes , aimed at destroying IS positions and assets , have caused some damage to the buildings . Natural Resources Minister Carl Sargeant has written to councils reminding them of the ban on fracking in Wales . He said fracking technology was \" \" , saying ministers preferred to look at energy . Fracking is a process of using pressure water to break up rocks to release gas and pipe it to the surface . It is a industry in the United States , but there are concerns about safety , the environment and water . There have been protests against applications for test drilling for gas in both the Vale of Glamorgan and Wrexham , as sites in England . Energy Secretary Amber Rudd has stressed the UK government 's support for fracking , and frustration at delays in its development . She has told councils in England to make decisions on applications within 16 weeks , to stop the process being \" dragged out for months \" . In his letter to councils , Mr Sargeant said the guidance applied to England and that the moratorium in Wales remained in place . \" The UK government 's support for oil and gas applications is to the approach of the Welsh Government of promoting and carbon forms of energy through the planning system and measures ,\" he said . \" We see energy as a element in ensuring that Wales achieves development for the benefit of generations . \" planning authorities must ensure that planning applications for energy projects are determined within timescales . \" Plans to devolve control over fracking were confirmed in the Queen 's Speech in June following the election victory .", "The exhibition , From Dark to Light , explores the work of artist Victor Noble Rainbird , who was born in North Shields in 1887 . The collection to have been staged since the 1930s , his subjects were the North Sea and the streets and people of his hometown . Curator Dave Young said there was a lot of affection for him in the town . of the pieces on display at The Old Low Light Heritage Centre in North Shields have been seen in public . Mr Young , said : \" We hope that this exhibition will shed light on the life and work of a man and a artist . \" This is the exhibition of his paintings to be held in his hometown of North Shields since the artist 's lifetime and it is being held in a building that he would have known and painted . \" Victor Noble Rainbird 's paintings are a legacy of life in the North East before and after the Great War , while his war record is being unravelled . \" Mr Rainbird joined the Northumberland Fusiliers in 1914 he was 26-years-old and served on the Western Front at Ypres , Passchendaele , Vimy Ridge and Armentieres . Some of the drawings he produced while on service have survived and are included in the exhibition . Mr Young said they were a \" , and record of the horrors of war \" . After the war , Rainbird made return trips to France , Belgium and the Netherlands , producing some of his works . He died aged 47 in 1936 . The White House said North Korea should \" focus on fulfilling its obligations \" . The reactor was shut down in 2007 as part of a disarmament-for-aid deal . But Pyongyang vowed to restart it in 2013 , following its test and amid tensions . White House spokesman Josh Earnest said the community would accept North Korea as a state . \" We will work with our partners in the context of the talks to try to return North Korea to a posture of fulfilling those commitments that they have made ,\" he said . \" We will repeat our call that North Korea should refrain from the provocations that aggravate tension and should focus on fulfilling its obligations and commitments . \" talks involving South Korea , the US , China , Japan and Russia aimed at ending the North 's programme have been stalled since 2009 . Experts believe that , , the Yongbyon reactor can make one bomb 's worth of plutonium per year . A US think-tank said this year that satellite images suggested work had started at the Yongbyon complex . But Tuesday 's announcement was the confirmation from North Korea that it had restarted operations . The news agency KCNA said North Korea was improving its weapons \" in quality and quantity \" . It said that the North was to face US hostility with \" weapons any time \" . , experts say North Korea 's capabilities are . Pyongyang claims it has made a device to fit a warhead on to a missile , which it could launch at its enemies . But US officials have cast doubt on the claim . North Korea has made threats against its neighbours and the US , to coincide with exercises held by South Korea and US forces . The City of Edinburgh Council assured those affected no details were accessed . Officials have warned of a increase in spam or phishing emails . They said the incident had been reported to both the Information Commissioner and the UK Government 's Computer Emergency Response Team and that security measures had been put in place . A council spokeswoman said : \" This was a cyber attack on the council 's website which is hosted in a UK data centre . It was dealt with and at no point were any council services affected . \" We are contacting everyone who has been affected to inform them of the incident and offer them advice and support . We have reassured individuals that the details that have been accessed are their email addresses . \" The Information Commissioner 's Office has been informed and measures have been taken by the web service providers . \" We want to reassure the public the ongoing security of our website is , and we continue to work with our service providers to ensure that the risks associated with attacks are dealt with . \"", "\" We have ideas for the future , and part of making them happen is building Instagram into a business ,\" it said . Ads will appear in a months and involve a handful of firms . Instagram was bought by Facebook for $ 1bn ( \u00c2 \u00a3 619m ) , but has made a profit . The company , which has 150 million users , has been a favourite among consumers but has left analysts wondering it could turn enthusiasm among photographers into a business model . efforts by Instagram to generate revenue were met with user backlash , as the company changed the terms of service to indicate that it would own user images and could sell those images to advertisers . The failure of this move was acknowledged in the company 's posting . \" As , you own your photos and videos . The introduction of advertising wo change this ,\" it said . In an interview this year with the BBC , Instagram co-founder Kevin Systrom said that Instagram must \" fund its future . \" media advertising is a booming business in the US . According to research firm eMarketer , advertisers will spend $ 9.5bn on network ads this year . Facebook has boosted its efforts to gain a share of this ad spending . Tidal Lagoon Power ( TLP ) said the claims had no \" basis \" . NRW said its figures were based on the \" evidence \" it received . In a briefing note sent to AMs and seen by BBC Wales , TLP disputed NRW 's figures and claimed that the regulator refused to share its methodology for calculating them . \" Without basis NRW has published figures based in these ' what if ' scenarios despite our request to consider the evidence needed to back them up to publication ,\" the briefing said . \" These scenarios give and misleading impact figures [ on fish ],\" the briefing adds . TLP said that computer modelling carried out by experts on its behalf estimated a \" case scenario \" of the lagoon killing 2 % of all species of fish . The arrogance of power The failure to organise the polls led to a wave of demonstrations by opposition supporters , with calls from diplomats for the president to respect the constitution . The Roman Catholic Church stepped in to broker a deal at the end of 2016 which outlined the creation of a government that would oversee the elections . But the deal collapsed because the government and the opposition were to agree on the power-sharing mechanism under the arrangement . The country of 71 million people has had a transfer of power since its independence from Belgium in 1960 .", "Fairfax said on Wednesday it would cut 125 jobs - a quarter of its newsroom - to absorb slumping revenues . In response , staff will strike until after week 's budget , one of the year 's news days . Fairfax 's outlets include the Sydney Morning Herald , Melbourne 's The Age and the Australian Financial Review . The cuts come in addition to restructuring and cuts in years . The Sydney Morning Herald 's correspondent James Massola tweeted \" On strike for a week \" , while his colleague Judith Ireland urged that \" quality journalism needs journalists to do the job \" . Like media outlets around the globe , Fairfax is suffering from falling circulation of its print editions and declining advertising revenue . The staff cuts were announced along with plans to scale the use of freelancers . \" While we will be looking across all parts of the newsroom , at the end of the redundancy program we expect there will be management , video , presentation and section writer roles ,\" the publisher is quoted as saying in an note . Australia 's Media Entertainment and Arts Alliance , which represents the country 's journalists , criticised the planned cuts at Fairfax as a \" move \" . \" This will undermine and damage its mastheads , alienating its audience and leaving the staff that remain to work and to fill the gaps ,\" executive Paul Murphy said . Fairfax is the rival to Rupert Murdoch 's News Corp Australia , which is suffering from falling revenues and has announced plans to cut jobs .", "Media playback is supported on this device The 17-year-old from Gloucestershire won the champion apprentice trophy in his season this year . Colombia 's president stopped the talks after the rebels seized Gen Ruben Dario Alzate and two others on 16 November . The captives were released on Sunday . They were handed over to a mission led by the International Red Cross and taken to a base near the city of Medellin before travelling to be reunited with their families . \" We consider the crisis over and announce that we have agreed that the cycle of conversations will take place between 10 and 17 December ,\" Reuters quoted a statement read by a official as saying . The negotiators said the round of talks would focus on a de-escalation of the conflict , and on meeting the relatives of victims . They said the parties had agreed to establish a system to deal with any crises . They will reconvene around mid-January , on a date determined . The negotiations have been under way in Havana since November 2012 and aim to bring an end to five decades of conflict , in which 220,000 people are estimated to have died . The Red Cross and the Farc said that the handover on Sunday had taken place in a location in Choco province , an jungle region on Colombia 's Pacific Coast . Gen Alzate , Cpl Jorge Rodriguez and lawyer Gloria Urrego had been kidnapped 14 days while travelling along the Atrato river by boat . They had ventured into territory dominated by the Farc in clothes and without a security detail . The Farc said they kidnapped the general because they were that President Juan Manuel Santos had continued operations against them during peace talks . The rebel group has renewed calls for both sides to call a ceasefire while the peace negotiations proceed . The government has rejected calls , saying that a truce would help the rebel group regroup and rearm . Gen Alzate resigned from his post on Monday , saying he should have taken security precautions .", "Akpan , 25 , had a goal disallowed for handball in Tuesday 's loss at Sheffield Wednesday , before being shown a card by Scott Duncan for his protests . Blackburn have been charged with failing to ensure players conducted themselves in an fashion . Akpan and Rovers have until 20 and 21 February to respond . This makes the drugs for treating cancers , the research team said . Prostate cancer is the cancer in men in the UK . one in eight men will get prostate cancer at some point in their lives . It affects men over the age of 50 . The cancer can be treated with hormone treatments , which target receptors linked to the growth of hormones called androgens . But some prostate cancers do work that way . they create an form of receptor which is linked to the growth of hormones and does respond to hormone treatment . This is the form of resistance in prostate cancer which leads to , cancers . The research , published in the journal Cancer Research , found that a class of drugs reduced production of both receptors . Professor Paul Workman , study author and executive of the Institute of Cancer Research , said it was an discovery . \" We call Hsp90 inhibitors ' network drugs' because they tackle of the signals that are hijacked in cancer all at , across a network than a signalling pathway . \" These drugs can hit cancer than those targeting one protein , and look for preventing or overcoming drug resistance . \" Prof Workman said the step was to test the Hsp90 inhibitors in trials on patients with , prostate cancer . Prof Johann de Bono , a professor of cancer medicine at the Institute of Cancer Research , said : \" These drugs are in trials for types of cancer , and I am that our work suggests they could benefit men with prostate cancer who have run out of treatment options . \"", "\" This will give all European Leagues freedom to schedule their matches as they see ,\" said the European Professional Football Leagues group . Graduates start repaying their debt once their income reaches \u00a3 21,000 but after 30 years debt is written off . For those repaying loans in 2017 the sum owed at the start of repayment was \u00a3 19,280 . That compares with \u00a3 32,220 for English students , \u00a3 20,990 for Northern Irish students and \u00a3 11,740 for students who do pay fees if they study in Scotland . The figures come from the Student Loans Company and cover 2016 / 17 . Welsh domiciled students have been to claim a grant towards their tuition fees since 2012-13 - a sum of \u00a3 4,954 in 2017-18 . But the grants are to be scrapped from 2018-19 with help for maintenance costs introduced , under plans unveiled year . At the end of 2016-17 there were 304,900 borrowers of education student loans in Wales , with 191,100 for repayment . As of the end of April 2017 there are 41,430 borrowers who had repaid , amounting to 16.4 % of the total . Published in the Lancet Psychiatry , their analysis of 61 studies suggests nicotine in cigarette smoke may be altering the brain . Experts said it was a \" case \" but needed research . Smoking has been associated with psychosis , but it has been believed that schizophrenia patients are to smoke because they use cigarettes as a form of self-medication to ease the distress of hearing voices or having hallucinations . The team at King 's looked at data involving 14,555 smokers and 273,162 non-smokers . It indicated : The argument is that if there is a rate of smoking before schizophrenia is diagnosed , smoking is a case of self-medication . Dr James MacCabe , from the Institute of Psychiatry , Psychology and Neuroscience at King 's , said : \" It 's to establish causation [ with this style of study ] , what we 're hoping that this does is open our eyes to the possibility that tobacco could be a agent in psychosis , and we hope this will lead to research and trials that would help to provide evidence . \" smokers do develop schizophrenia , but the researchers believe it is increasing the risk . The incidence of the condition is one in every 100 people , which may be increased to two per 100 by smoking . The researchers said nicotine altered levels of the brain chemical dopamine , which has been implicated in the psychosis . Prof Michael Owen , the director of the Institute of Psychological Medicine at Cardiff University , said the researchers had made a \" case \" that smoking may increase the risk of schizophrenia . \" The fact is that it is to prove causation without a trial , but there are plenty of reasons for targeting health measures at the . \" The charity Rethink Mental Illness said : \" We know that 42 % of all cigarettes smoked in England are by people with health problems , and any findings about the link between smoking and psychosis is a worry . \" , studies are needed to understand this link . \"", "Two crews and a hovercraft from Weston-super-Mare were called after midnight to rescue two adults and the children from Uphill beach . But the Wales Audit Office found the board breached its rules and regulations in handling the funding . Board officials said they would learn from the experience after auditors highlighted a lack of transparency and conflicts of interest . Auditors found the health board failed to follow procurement rules appointing suppliers for the event . The Lap of Wales Challenge was organised by Cerddwn Ymlaen under the leadership of its organiser Eryl Vaughan and was fronted by the opera singer Rhys Meirion . The event cost than \u00a3 150,000 to arrange and the surplus was \u00a3 1,368 . The challenge saw a number of celebrities undertaking a journey through Wales in July 2015 to raise awareness of the Welsh Government 's changes to the organ donation law . It was arranged in aid of Cronfa Elen . The fund was set up by Mr Meirion in memory of his sister who died in 2012 , and was incorporated within BCUHB 's charity , Awyr Las / Blue Sky in 2014 . The health board awarded \u00a3 20,000 towards the event , with another \u00a3 20,000 coming from Cardiff and Vale Health Board and \u00a3 45,000 from the Welsh Government . The report found \u00a3 10,000 of BCUHB 's contribution was awarded as a loan , but the paperwork was processed by the health board 's team . Despite that , the funds were transferred . Cerddwn Ymlaen said it was it received a loan than a grant and would have agreed to it , had it known . To ensure the Lap of Wales project was in deficit , Cerddwn Ymlaen undertook fundraising to meet the \u00a3 154,054 cost of completing the challenge . Concerns were raised about a breach of the health board 's regulations in relation to the challenge . A spokesperson for BCUHB said : \" The health board was to learn from this experience which is it asked the Wales Audit Office to carry out this review , as we recognise that to achieve the objectives of the charity , it is to work with bodies . \" arrangements are underpinned by trust , objectives and cooperation but misunderstandings can occur . \" Officials added a joint-working protocol would provide a governance framework for projects and require all arrangements to be formalised .", "The incident happened on Morningside Road , near to Jordan Lane , at 11:45 on Sunday . The trams started running at 06:00 BST . Despite facing criticism for causing disruption to businesses and commuters , Nottingham City Council insists the service will transform the economy . Delays were blamed on numbers of pipes and cables having to be moved , and on work to replace part of the track bed . \u00a3 570m budget 28 stations 11 miles of track 22 trams 20 million passenger capacity Contractor Vinci has reported the problems contributed to a \u00a3 165m loss for its engineering division . That has led to the loss of than 5,000 jobs in the North Sea oil industry . The panel will address hate crime and access to health and education .", "The world was found beyond our Solar System , 100 light-years . It 's been named 51 Eridani b and is 20 million years - by standards . The world could give us information about the formation of our Solar System . The find was made by the Gemini Planet Imager ( GPI ) , which looks for planets orbiting stars . Our Jupiter is the planet in the system - it 's you could fit over 1,300 Earths inside it ! It 's the rotating planet , with 1 day lasting 10 hours - but a year on Jupiter lasts for 12 Earth years . Jupiter does have a surface and is made up of gas , giving it the name ' gas giant ' . The baby Jupiter has the methane gas signature found on an planet . The astronomers detected water using the GPI 's spectrometer instrument . Scientists hope that by studying worlds , they can learn about the structure of our Solar System is . Astronomers believe the gas giants in our Solar System formed - by building up a core over a million years and pulling a amount of hydrogen and gases to form an atmosphere . This is known as a \" \" . But the planets that have been discovered are than scientists have predicted . Which could mean they formed - as gas collapses to make a planet in what is known as a ' hot-start ' .", "Kitchens , toilets and washing facilities haven been installed at Tredegar Park with the demonstration expected on Saturday , five days before the summit . than 150 heads of state and ministers will attend the event at Newport 's Celtic Manor Resort . Samantha will operate a gadget called an levitator , which can heat metals to 2,000\u00c2 \u00b0 C and cool them . It 's hoped the results will reveal about the physics of the metals and they work . Samantha will be testing machine technology and they work in space , as this astronaut joystick . Using a joystick in space may feel in space compared to on Earth . these experiments will see being in space might affect an astronaut can control a space robot or space machinery . Another thing is that equipment may need to be attached to the astronaut so it does float . The testing will see what impact this has . Samantha will be doing lots of experiments to see being in space affects her body . For example , she will experience 16 sunrises and sunsets every day on the International Space Station and be tested to see this affects her body clock . Another subject is food and energy . Experiments to see food an astronaut would need for a mission will be carried out . It is a element of a package of reforms promised by Prime Minister Matteo Renzi . The law seeks to end Italy 's era of revolving governments , horse-trading and coalitions . The house of parliament gave approval to the bill by 334 votes to 61 . The election system awards 340 out of 630 seats to any party that wins than 40 % of the vote . If no party reaches that threshold , there is a run-off between the two parties with the votes . The reform is expected to come into force year . After the vote , Mr Renzi said : \" Commitment achieved , promise . Italy needs people who do say no . \" Critics have accused the mayor of Florence who became minster year of trying to consolidate his grip on power . They complain that the law awards power to parties , gives party bosses scope to select candidates , and denies voters the chance to choose representatives . Opposition parties boycotted Monday 's vote . Renato Brunetta , head of opposition party Forza Italia , said that it was \" a day for our country 's democracy \" . Mr Renzi wants to transform the system by abolishing the Senate and replacing it with a non-elected body with powers . , legislation is held up because versions of bills have to be approved by both houses .", "The Dow Jones rose 0.2 % to 19,251.78 , while the S & P 500 gained 0.3 % to 2,204.71 , missing a record . Subs used : Pickford , Iorfa , Loftus-Cheek , Baker , Chilwell .", "He claims Universal Music have paid the band a \" fraction \" of the money they were owed from downloads on sites like iTunes and Amazon . The musician is suing for compensation , according to documents filed in Los Angeles on Wednesday . The claim is filed on behalf of his sister , Karen , who died in 1983 . Carpenter hired accountants to examine statements from Universal Music and its subsidiary , A & M Records , which has released The Carpenters' music since their debut album in 1969 . He says they found errors , and that the labels \" classified \" revenue from downloads of The Carpenters' music as sales of records - which attract a royalty rate . He claims that downloads were undercounted . In a statement , Carpenter said he had been to resolve the dispute without suing . \" The Carpenters recordings are among the sellers in the history of music , and after 48 years continue to contribute a amount to [ Universal 's ] line ,\" he wrote . \" It seems that these companies account to my sister 's estate and to me . \" Specialising in rock , The Carpenters sold millions of records in the 1970s . The brother-sister duo won three Grammy Awards in 1970 and 1971 , including artist and performance for the ballad ( They Long to Be ) to You . The band 's career was cut Karen developed anorexia nervosa in 1975 . Although they continued to record , the condition led to her death , from heart failure . Richard Carpenter 's claim is one of filed in the US after a 2010 court case involving Eminem , which resulted in a ruling that artists should receive royalty payments for downloads than they do a CD or vinyl album is sold . The difference is . According to Billboard , artists get 15 % of the money generated by the sale of a record . For downloads , which are counted as \" content \" , the figure 50 % . Artists including Peter Frampton , Public Enemy , Whitesnake and The Temptations have all sued , or threatened to sue , in order to obtain the rate . Universal Music were to respond to the case . It added there had been a \" slowdown \" in growth from year . , the figure for the quarter was in line with economists' expectations . Analysts said the rise in growth was to change expectations that the Bank of England will keep interest rates at their record low week . On Monday , the International Monetary Fund downgraded its forecast for UK growth this year because of the figure . The IMF said it expects UK GDP to grow by 1.7 % of its projection of 2 % . The evidence will be used to develop recommendations for care providers and bodies . It is part of Ms Rochira 's review into the quality of life and care of people in care in Wales . She said she would highlight care but show the impact of care upon people . \" The voices of people , as those who care for and care about them , are at the heart of my work as commissioner , which is I want to hear about their experiences of care ,\" she said . \" I have travelled across Wales , meeting with people living in care , and have seen for myself the impact that quality care can have on people 's lives . \" , I have received an increasing amount of correspondence in the year about the quality of life and care of people living in care and I have spoken about what I consider to be variations across Wales . \" The commissioner will be reviewing whether people living in care have a quality of life by looking at factors as and health , relationships and the care home environment . Her team will speak to care providers , care staff and bodies . \" By giving a voice to people and their families , my review and recommendations will ensure that those who are for and run our services understand the realities of living in care in Wales and the action required to deliver the change needed to ensure that that people living in care have the quality of life ,\" she said . The chair of Care Forum Wales , Mario Kreft , said his group was dedicated to developing and promoting practice in care and it supported the aims of the review . \" Our disappointment - which will be shared by providers - is that the commissioner has included a provider expert on the panel ,\" he said . \" as we can see no-one who has lived in , worked in , managed or owned a care home is represented on the panel . \" In our view , this misses the opportunity for partnership working and to engage the sector into the advisory panel . \"", "Mr Evans joined the service in 2010 and is secretary to the Welsh Government . A Uefa report released on Thursday said it was \" \" for anyone to tell whether higenamine is a prohibited substance by reading Wada 's banned list . \" The fact that the Cologne laboratory tested for higenamine but had to check with Wada before making a determination indicates a problem , as does the fact that the Lausanne laboratory does test for it ,\" it added . \" The onus is on Wada to communicate to its laboratories what is and what is on the prohibited list . \" There are gaps in communication with regard to higenamine , something which tends to support the suggestion that Wada 's procedure and analysis in respect of this substance is . \" Sakho , 27 , admitted taking the substance without Liverpool 's knowledge but contended it was on the banned list , which was supported by the report into the case by Uefa 's control , ethics and body . Services will divert to platforms or Glasgow Central , bringing timetable changes and in some cases , journey times . The work is part of a \u00c2 \u00a3 60m upgrade project that will allow and trains to use the station . Passengers on ScotRail 's Edinburgh to Glasgow service , via Falkirk High , are being advised to travel via Bathgate and Airdrie . That journey will take 70 minutes . Phil Verster , managing director of the ScotRail Alliance , said : \" Upgrading the tunnel will allow us to run , , trains in the future . \" This will mean seats , journey times and impact on our environment . \" The benefits of this investment will be , for our railway , but for the country . \" ScotRail said the closure was to enable engineering work to renew 1,800m of existing slab track formation , which carries the rails through the 918m tunnel . The firm said this was the engineering project undertaken on the Edinburgh to Glasgow , via Falkirk High , railway , since it was built . The project will involve 140 days of working , the removal of 10,000 tonnes of existing concrete slab and the installation of 4,000m of rails . ScotRail has launched a webpage to give passengers information about the impact of the project . Transport Minister Derek Mackay said : \" This is a in a generation project and one of the planned on the Edinburgh-Glasgow route . \" The works will support the introduction of a generation of , and trains on routes across the Central Belt year . \" Although I understand that this work will cause some inconvenience to passengers , the ScotRail Alliance is working to ensure that services are maintained , disruption is kept to a minimum and that passengers are kept informed throughout the work . \"", "Media playback is supported on this device Al Hasawi , who took control of the Reds in the summer of 2012 , would reveal the identity of the buyers . , BBC Sport understands that a United States consortium , led by millionaire John Jay Moores , is on the verge of securing a \u00a3 50m deal . The minister allayed fears about job losses in a letter to Swansea East AM Mike Hedges . Mr Hedges said the minister 's response would \" give comfort \" to DVLA employees . Concerns over the future of some of the 5,000 workers at the Driving and Vehicle Licensing Agency centre were raised in October after Chancellor George Osborne 's Autumn Statement . The chancellor announced that the tax disc would be replaced with an system in October 2014 . The system will allow people to pay the charge by debit . Mr Hedges had written to Mr Hammond asking for clarification of the government 's intentions . In his response to Mr Hedges , Mr Hammond said : \" It is that the introduction of a debit scheme may mean there will be a reduction in the amount of refunds received , in addition to the withdrawal of the tax disc . \" This may mean changes to job roles and the need to train on processes . \" Any reductions in numbers of people needed for these activities will be managed through redeploying to growth areas of the business . \" Mr Hedges welcomed the minister 's assurances . He added : \" Whilst that the changes will reduce the number of job opportunities at the DVLA , I can see the advantages of both paying by debits and having to show a tax disc . \" I am the minister is to redeployment than redundancies and I am this response will give comfort to DVLA employees . \"", "The England and Wales Cricket Board made the move in an attempt to improve the standard of pitches and Rhodes says it has made a difference . \" I think it has ,\" he told BBC Hereford and Worcester . \" If you look , there have been some wickets - this was the way they could do it . \" The England wicketkeeper added : \" I think , to a extent , it 's worked . \" There have been some criticisms about wickets being but if you 're to bat for a period of time and concentrate , you 'll get runs . \" Worcestershire 's two Championship matches - which have both been draws - have produced eight centuries , with five coming in the match against Gloucestershire and three in their game with Essex . Mr Gillard will appear in court on 1 May .", "The rock is an volcano that lies 260 miles ( 418km ) of the Western Isles and is 30m ( 100ft ) and 21m ( 70ft ) above the sea . The Nato documents report the UK claimed Rockall in 1955 . The government feared that it could be used by \" agents \" as a place to monitor the Hebrides Rocket Range . A team of personnel was taken to Rockall by the Royal Navy in September 1955 to claim as UK territory . A Union Flag was raised and a plaque installed on the rock . In the documents , it says : \" This decision of the UK government was connected with the fact that the UK government had decided to set up a guided missile range in South Uist , in the Outer Hebrides . \" The island of Rockall was but this government wished to guard against the possibility of agents installing themselves on the island in order to observe the effects of the tests on the South Uist range . \" People have stayed on Rockall , though , in the past , including in 1997 three campaigners from Greenpeace managed to climb on to the rock . They lived on Rockall for 42 days and renamed it Waveland in protest at exploration of oil and gas reserves in the surrounding seabed . In 2014 , a Scots adventurer broke the record for occupying the North Atlantic rock . Adventurer Nick Hancock survived for 43 days , beating the record held by three Greenpeace campaigners who lived for 42 days . The time beat the record of 40 days set by Tom McClean in 1985 . Mr Hancock celebrated achieving the record by popping a bottle of champagne while sending a tweet with a message to adventurer Mr McClean , of Morar in the west Highlands . The expenditure over the period came to \u00a3 4.3bn , which led to a value-added ( GVA ) boost to the economy of \u00a3 8.3bn . , spending in London was three times the rest of the UK combined . The report said : \" The effect of BBC spending is ' multiplied ' as it ripples through the economy from region to region and sector to sector ( and to the employees of those sectors ) . This is known as the ' multiplier effect '.\" The BBC 's and policy adviser Najma Rajah explained : \" The premise is that the BBC spends a pound , the impact of that pound is ' multiplied ' as that pound spent by the BBC creates value in the economy . \" , for example , if the BBC were to buy a camera from a supplier in Manchester , the camera supplier would receive some money in return for the camera . \" The camera company would use the income generated from the sale of the camera to pay their suppliers for the components that went into the camera and to pay their employees and . \" Rajah added : \" A example of this multiplier effect works is the BBC commissions a programme that is made by an television production . \" The programme might be filmed in Scotland using runners , electricians , make-up artists etc . who are paid and will spend their wages in Scotland to the benefit of the economy . \" The report revealed growth in the north of England following the opening of the BBC North headquarters in Salford Quays , with GVA growing 19.7 % to \u00a3 391m . But in the Midlands , it fell 21.7 % to \u00a3 199m , while the south was 18.8 % to \u00a3 699m and Wales dropped 6.2 % to \u00a3 276m . London saw the expenditure of \u00a3 2.98bn - three times as the rest of the UK combined - which in turn generated \u00a3 5.65bn GVA . John Tate , the BBC 's director of policy and strategy , used the findings of the report to call on Ofcom to reverse its plans for a spectrum tax on broadcasters next year . In a blog post he wrote : \" The benefit of the licence fee provides an reason for Ofcom to think before it implements a spectrum tax year : a levy on the spectrum broadcasters use to transmit their programmes . \" as hitting licence fee payers , such a tax would remove cash from the UK 's sector . \"", "Security assistance has been withheld since 2011 , the Gulf state put down protests . She was the person born in the 1800s living . She had attributed her longevity to her genetics and a diet of three eggs a day , two of them . Ms Morano was the of eight siblings , all of whom she has outlived . She died at her home in the city of Verbania . Her life spanned three centuries but survived an marriage , the loss of her son , two World Wars and than 90 governments . Ms Morano had admitted that her longevity was to genetics : her mother reached 91 and sisters reached their centenary . But it was to a diet of three eggs - two - each day for than 90 years . It was a regime she took up as a woman , after the doctor diagnosed her with anaemia after World War One . She had cut down to two eggs a day , and a biscuits . Her doctor of 27 years , Carlo Bava , had told AFP news agency that she ate vegetables or fruit . \" I met her , she ate three eggs per day , two raw in the morning and an omelette at noon , and chicken at dinner . \" Ms Morano credited her longevity to her decision , in 1938 , to kick out her husband - a year after her baby boy died at six months . The marriage had been , she said . She had been in love with a boy who was killed during World War One , and had no interest in marrying someone . But , she told La Stampa newspaper in an interview she was a 112 that she was left with choice . \" He told me : ' If you 're you marry me , or I 'll kill you ' . I was 26 years . I got married . \" , it became . Though they separated in 1938 , they remained until he died in 1978 . Ms Morano , who worked until she was 75 , chose to marry . \" I did want to be dominated by anyone ,\" she told the New York Times . She had taken on a carer a couple of years - but had left her apartment for 20 years . According to the US-based Gerontology Research Group ( GRG ) , the world 's being is Violet Brown , who was born on March 10 , 1900 .", "Owens' team suffered a record defeat as they conceded nine tries in a 64-14 Champions Cup hammering in Paris . The discoveries were made in Acre state in the Amazon . Researchers from the universities of Exeter and Reading , and Brazil 's S\u00c3 \u00a3 o Paulo , Bel\u00c3 \u00a9 m are part of the team . Their research investigated ditched enclosures which were concealed for centuries by rainforest until deforestation allowed the discovery of than 450 \" geoglyphs \" . The team said the function of these sites is understood . They are to be villages , since archaeologists have recovered artefacts during excavation , and their layout does suggest they were built for reasons . it is thought they were used , as ritual gathering places , to the Maya pyramids of Central America , or Britain 's Stonehenge . Although Dr Loader - who has analysed soil samples from the geoglyphs - said the surroundings in which they were built were to sites around the world . He looked at phytoliths - a type of plant fossil made of silica - to reconstruct vegetation ; charcoal quantities , to assess the amount of forest burning ; and carbon stable isotopes , to indicate the type of vegetation growing in the past . \" The indications are that the geoglyphs were constructed amongst vegetation . , unlike the towering Maya pyramids of Central America , they were above the forest canopy , and this raises questions about their purpose ,\" he explained . It had been assumed to the arrival of Europeans in the Century , the forests had been ecosystems , from influence . But the research indicates a variety of plant species spread over 6,000 years , which could have been brought by humans . It suggested of burning tracts of forest - either for geoglyph construction or practices - people transformed their environment by concentrating on trees as palms . The team have likened it to a form of \" supermarket \" of forest products . They said there is \" tantalizing evidence \" to suggest the biodiversity of some of Acre 's remaining forests may retain a legacy of these \" agroforestry \" practices to this day .", "Two of the songs come from the Don Quixote musical Man of La Mancha , which was a Broadway smash in the 1960s . \" as I am concerned , Don Quixote is the character that I know ,\" the Hobbit star said . \" handed , he is trying to change the world , of any consequences . Experts from Cardiff University , Swansea University , the University of Bristol , Bangor University and Cardiff 's University Hospital of Wales looked at the data of 95 % of all people in Wales with type 1 diabetes . They said money should be spent on improving care with cases rising 3-4 % a year . L\u00f3pez is three years into a sentence for inciting violence during protests in 2014 .", "Anthony McIntyre conducted a series of interviews with IRA members , on the understanding that the contents would be made until after their deaths . Boston College has been issued with a subpoena instructing it to hand over the material on 6 May . Mr McIntyre said he had engaged a lawyer to \" resist the efforts to raid his memoirs \" . Dozens of loyalists and republicans provided testimonies to Boston College staff compiling an history of the Northern Ireland conflict . What are the ' Boston tapes ' ? Dozens of paramilitaries were interviewed in Belfast and cities and towns from 2001-2006 as part of an history project known as the Belfast Project . Details about politics and activities of the IRA were revealed on tape , including accounts of a hunger strike in prison in the 1980s . , the project cost $ 200,000 ( \u00c2 \u00a3 118,520 ) , provided by an businessman . Each interview was transcribed , sent by encrypted email to New York and the material was sent to Boston College , it was placed under lock and key at Burns Library . Following a battle with the college , the Police Service of Northern Ireland gained access to a number of the interviews in 2013 . Interviews were given on the understanding that tapes would be made until after their deaths . Detectives want to access the recordings as part of their investigations into murder and crimes from the 1970s to 1990s . In June year , police were given access to interviews given by prisoner Winston Rea . It followed a decision by judges in Belfast to lift an injunction on the PSNI taking possession of Mr Rea 's recorded account to Boston College researchers . In 2013 , detectives investigating the abduction and murder of Belfast mother-of-10 Jean McConville in 1972 secured the transcripts of IRA woman Dolours Price 's account . That material was handed over following court battles on both sides of the Atlantic .", "The pet , which is 12 months , has a shell and the shop appealed for information on Facebook , saying it was about its \" care requirements \" . Some of the birds at the premises in Lincolnshire have died . The rest are to be culled . Defra said an investigation was \" under way to determine the source of the infection \" . A 1.8-mile ( 3km ) protection zone and a ( 10km ) surveillance area have been set up around the turkey rearing farm to reduce the risk of the disease spreading . An outbreak of the virus in a flock of 6,000 turkeys at Low Farm , in Fulstow , near Louth , was \" to be linked to the case \" at the Austen Fen Farm , Defra had said . All restrictions were removed around Austen Fen Farm on 18 January but remain at Low Farm while an inquiry continues . This case in Boston comes two days after bird flu was found in pheasants that were being bred at a farm in Wyre , Lancashire . The strain has been discovered in birds in Settle , North Yorkshire , a swannery in Dorset and flocks in Carmarthenshire , west Wales . Under the deal , any returns would be and \" conditions were \" . Cameroon has rejected the accusation and said people returned . According to the UNHCR , than 2,600 refugees have been returned to Nigeria from Cameroon this year . are to go to their villages in Borno state for security reasons and have ended up in camps for displaced people . In some cases , the UNHCR said , people had been returned \" without allowing them time to collect their belongings \" . UNHCR spokesman Babar Baloch spoke of \" chaos \" in the returns process and said \" some women were forced to leave their children in Cameroon , including a child than three years \" . of the returnees are settled in the Banki camp for displaced people . UNHCR staff recorded 17 people who claimed to be nationals , who it said had been deported by mistake to Banki . It is in the region to find people who have no proof of their nationality . Cameroonian Communications Minister Issa Tchiroma told the BBC 's Focus on Africa programme : \" I deny this accusation \" of forced returns . He said the army had been working \" \" with the army against Boko Haram and any civilians who had returned to Nigeria had done of their accord . \" This repatriation has taken place ,\" he said . The authorities have said Boko Haram militants have been entering the country disguised as refugees . Militants have carried out a number of attacks in Cameroon in years , using suicide bombers . The UNHCR said forced return constitutes a violation of the 1951 Refugee Convention and the 1969 OAU Convention , both of which Cameroon has ratified . It called on Cameroon to honour its obligations under the conventions and continue keeping its borders so as to allow access to territory and asylum procedures for people fleeing the insurgency .", "Annie Woodland , 24 , who lived in Essex , suffered brain damage in the incident at Gloucester Park Pool in Basildon . France , the power , has commented on the request . Mr Sankara 's widow and supporters have accused France of masterminding his 1987 killing because he was a Marxist revolutionary . He was killed by soldiers in a hail of bullets before a meeting of his cabinet in Burkina Faso 's capital , Ouagadougou . Mr Sankara 's assassination led to his second-in-command , Blaise Compaore , seizing power in a coup . Mr Compaore steered Burkina Faso into a alliance with France , which retains , security and ties with of its colonies in Africa . Burkina Faso opened an investigation into the killing after he was ousted from power in 2014 . Speaking at a press conference in Ouagadougou , the family lawyer , Benewende Stanislas Sankara , said an investigating judge had asked authorities to declassify documents to see whether France had played a role in the assassination . A request had been made to interview officials who were involved in Burkina Faso 's affairs at the time , the lawyer added . Burkina Faso issued an arrest warrant for Mr Compaore in 2015 , accusing him of involvement in Mr Sankara 's killing . He has denied the allegation , but has refused to return to Burkina Faso to stand trial . London ranked than Scotland 's cities in the survey of the UK 's roads by Inrix Roadway Analytics . It found that the jams could cost drivers in Scotland \u00a3 5.1bn in wasted time over the decade . The firm studied traffic hotspots in 21 UK cities in September 2016 . It assessed the impact of the congestion by looking at the duration of traffic jams , their length and the number of times they occurred . The research found that the impact of Edinburgh 's 455 traffic hotspots was to London and was to cost drivers \u00a3 2.8bn by 2025 . Glasgow was ranked in the list - than Birmingham , Manchester and Bristol . It 's 357 hotspots could cost \u00a3 2.3bn over the 10 years , Inrix said . Researchers calculated the time wasted by drivers in traffic jams across the UK could cost \u00a3 61.8bn by 2025 if congestion levels are reduced . And in their survey of 123 cities across Europe , London was found to have traffic \" pinch points \" than any city . It ranked in an assessment of the impact of its traffic jams . There were 1,144 bankruptcies , which was 14.7 % on the quarter and 51.1 % than a year . , AiB said the figures showed a \" return to trend \" . A year , the number of insolvencies in Scotland fell to its level for than 14 years following the introduction of the Bankruptcy and Debt Advice ( Scotland ) Act . The legislation introduced measures as money advice for people seeking access to debt relief solutions as sequestration . Although the bankruptcy figures were on a year , they were 41.7 % than the quarter in 2013-14 and 34.9 % than in 2014-15 . insolvencies include both bankruptcies and trust deeds ( PTDs ) . The number of PTDs recorded between April and June remained at 1,261 , a 2.1 % increase from the quarter . debt payment programmes approved under the Debt Arrangement Scheme ( DAS ) fell by 5.2 % on the quarter , to 510 . figures for bankruptcies and PTDs since 2005-06 : Business Minister Paul Wheelhouse said : \" These figures indicate that people are becoming to the insolvency legislation and processes . \" We are seeing the numbers settling down to a pattern following the , and expected , drop after the introduction of the laws . \" Compared to the quarter from two years , to these changes , the number of people falling into insolvency today is by than a third . \" This shows those in need can access the debt relief they require to help them on the road to a start - but that the term movement is a one . \" Eileen Blackburn , from insolvency trade body R3 , said : \" This rise , driven by an increase in bankruptcies , bucks the trend in insolvencies we 've seen in years . \" The number of insolvencies have been falling since their peak in 2012 , and this quarter represents a return to levels . \" The rise is do with the EU referendum result , which happened towards the end of the quarter , and to do with difficulties in the economy and the end of the year in March . \"", "One of the 11 children described the trailer went \" down the hill \" at the farm in Nottinghamshire before it \" launched us off \" . The proposed cycle route will link Leith Walk in the east of the city to Roseburn in the west , via the city centre and Haymarket . The plans include reducing four lanes of traffic from Roseburn to Haymarket to two , and using half a carriageway and a bus lane for cyclists . Supporters of the path said it was for cutting congestion and would provide a route across the city . They said it would encourage travel . But residents and shop owners in the Roseburn area said reducing loading bays to make way for bikes would have a impact on passing trade , and that reducing traffic lanes could increase congestion at Roseburn . The council said the working group would be set up to help resolve design issues with the plans . It said work would start to secure funding and to \" make preparations to commence the processes for the scheme \" . A decision will be taken after the the working group 's discussions . Transport convener Councillor Lesley Hinds said the council was \" 100 % committed \" to the project but acknowledged it had divided opinion . She said a group would be formed to try to reach a conclusion on the route design \" which the majority are with \" . The motoring body said these were the increases for three and a half years . Its fuel spokesman , Simon Williams , said retailers had \" no choice \" but to put up prices on garage forecourts . \" The effects of the pound have been felt on the wholesale market , and this , combined with an oil price at double its level in 2016 , has put pressure on fuel prices ,\" he said . \" , we are a way from the fuel prices enjoyed by families and businesses in 2016 , the price of unleaded was around 102p per litre and diesel was 101p ,\" he added . According to the RAC , the increases mean it costs \u00c2 \u00a3 64.20 to fill the 55-litre petrol tank of a family car . it costs \u00c2 \u00a3 65.25 to fill up a tank in a diesel car . The RAC suggested that the price of fuel might stabilise in the coming months . \" Opec , which represents some of the world 's oil producers , agreed in principle a cut in production ,\" said Mr Williams . \" But a deal is to be agreed at an Opec meeting at the end of this month and , with some analysts suggesting a deal might stall , this leaves open the prospect oil prices might stabilise or fall before the end of the year ,\" he added .", "East Oxford residents have been complaining about the behaviour of Oxford Brookes students on nights out . She said : \" The safety of our patients is to us and it is an decision to make but this will help us contain the spread of this bug . \" The hospital has asked the public to visit its accident and emergency department if they have symptoms of the bug . Norovirus - which causes vomiting , stomach cramps , fever and diarrhoea - is spread from person to person . Symptoms begin between 12 to 48 hours after a person becomes infected , with people making a recovery within one to three days . East Kilbride has the rate of all towns , at 33 % , while Inverurie has the , at 1 % . The study found that 40 % of Scotland 's shops have remained for than three years . It suggested that town vacancy rates have improved at twice the rate of Scotland 's cities . The towns were Anstruther , Clydebank , Dumfries , Inverkeithing , Lochgelly , Peterhead and Pitlochry . Five towns have maintained vacancy rates at than 6 % for the three years - Inverurie , Ellon , North Berwick , Dunbar and Biggar . At the end of the scale , rates in five towns have remained above 22 % over the three years - Banff , Dumbarton , Cumbernauld , East Kilbride and Ardrossan . Dundee had the proportion of vacancy , at 11 % . Anstruther was found to have the proportion of shops ( 86 %) , while Gretna had the ( 5 %) . Leisure is an presence in cities and towns , accounting for 39 % of stock in Edinburgh and Glasgow . Founder Michael Eavis , who was at Yeovil Magistrates' Court , said the sewage was in a \u00a3 100,000 slurry tank . The Glastonbury Festival is one of the UK 's music events , with some 175,000 people attending each year . During the hearing , the judge was told that 42 fish were killed by the sewage after a \" quantity \" of sewage filtered into Whitelake River . Sensors in the stream alerted the Environment Agency to increased ammonia levels . The court was told fish - including protected trout - died as a result . Glastonbury Festival 2014 admitted the charge against it . Prosecuting , Kieran Martyn said : \" The impact was ... It extended for at 4km . \" Representing the festival , Kerry Gwyther , said the leak in the tank was a \" incident \" and as was being made out . \" We do accept that it was a incident as described by the agency ,\" he said . \" The leak period was eight hours . We do accept that there was a effect on water quality and the fish health . \" costs were incurred in terms of a clean up . \" The case has been adjourned while both parties put background reports . court Michael Eavis said : \" , I 'm for what 's happened . \" We had a problem - there were 200,000 people and we were storing slurry . \" It was a tank for holding farm slurry , but on this occasion we were using it for the festival sewage and it was starting to leak . \" It was a brand build , it cost me \u00a3 100,000 , so that 's my defence . \" Another issue to be decided is the seriousness of the breach . If it is a category one offence , the festival would be in line for a fine of between \u00a3 55,000 to \u00a3 300,000 or , if it is deemed a category two the would be \u00a3 20,000 . The defence team told the court any fine should be in line with the company 's finances . They said the festival 's profit was \u00a3 84,000 a year before tax . But the prosecution said turnover was \u00a3 37m . Mr Gwyther said the site donated \u00a3 2m in 2015 to a number of charities , including the Somerset Wildlife Trust and WaterAid . District Judge David Taylor said there was \" differences between one account to another \" and said there would be a hearing to decide the facts before sentencing . The firm has operations in Larne , Newtownabbey and west Belfast . Caterpillar 's Northern Ireland business employs 1,800 people and makes diesel generators . The firm has been hit by a downturn in mining and oil exploration which has reduced demand for its products . It is understood that the company may announce cuts across its operations beyond Northern Ireland . It has axed thousands of jobs since year as part of a restructuring programme . Since 2011 it has shed than 1,000 posts in Northern Ireland and moved some work to factories in China . It is calling for broadband access for homes and business . A government spokesperson said UK homes can get \" \" broadband . \" nine out of ten UK properties has access to speeds and 95 % of the UK will be reached by 2017 ,\" a spokesperson for the Department for Culture , Media and Sport told the BBC . But the IoD believes the target should be and is calling for speeds of 10 gigabits per second ( Gbps ) by 2030 , 1,000 times than the aim of 10 megabits per second ( Mbps ) by 2020 . \" is the time to set a target for broadband ,\" said Dan Lewis , advisor on Infrastructure Policy at the IoD , and author of the report . \" We have the leading internet economy in the G20 , and download speeds are and the coverage of fibre cable is . \" He added : \" , the Government 's target displays a poverty of ambition . \" Mr Lewis said the government needed to look at the UK could provide the infrastructure needed to maintain a position \" at the forefront of innovation in business \" . IoD members interviewed for the report said that broadband speeds could increase their company 's productivity , make them , and enable them to offer working to their staff . The IoD report comes days after communications watchdog Ofcom said BT must open up its cable network and allow competition to improve UK internet connections . Ofcom said there was a divide in the UK between those with the technologies , and those without . It has proposed that , broadband should be a right . Rivals had called for a split between BT and its Openreach operation , which runs its cables , fibre and network infrastructure . The name for Bhutan , Druk Yul , means \" Land of the Thunder Dragon \" and it began to open up to outsiders in the 1970s . The Wangchuck monarchy has wielded power since 1907 . But Bhutan became a democracy after elections in March 2008 . Population 750,000 Area 38,364 sq km ( 14,812 sq miles ) language Dzongkha Major religions Buddhism ( official ) , Hinduism Life expectancy 66 years ( men ) , 70 years ( women ) Currency ngultrum Head of state : King Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck succeeded his father , Jigme Singye Wangchuck , in December 2006 after the monarch announced his abdication . His predecessor had given up some of his powers in 1998 and ruled in conjunction with the government , an assembly and a advisory council . Prime Minister : Tshering Tobgay Tshering Tobgay was elected Bhutan 's minister in July 2013 , succeeding Jigme Yozer Thinley . He is president of the People 's Democratic Party . He was leader of the opposition in the National Assembly from March 2008 to April 2013 . He has projected himself as a reformer , rejecting limousine and accommodation . Television did come to Bhutan until 1999 . For years , the country cut itself off , fearing that influences would undermine its monarchy and culture . Radio broadcasting began in 1973 and the internet arrived in 1999 . Some dates in the history of Bhutan : 1720 - army invades and establishes control over Bhutan . 1772-73 - intervention . 1864-65 - intervention by Britain . 1907 - Ugyen Wangchuck is chosen as ruler . 1910 - Treaty giving Britain control over relations . 1949 - Treaty signed with India guaranteeing non-interference in Bhutan 's affairs , but allowing Delhi influence over relations . 1958 - Slavery abolished . 1974 - tourists allowed in . 1990 - Thousands of Hindus flee to Nepal following clashes . 1998 - King cedes some powers to assembly .", "The Kerr , who coaches Stirling University 's Lowland League men 's side , will take over from Finland-bound Anna Signeul in June .
