Carbon permits are a mechanism designed to reduce carbon dioxide emissions , as companies have to pay to emit C02 . A drop in demand for energy has led to a oversupply of permits . Critics of the EU 's Emissions Trading System argue that the European Union issued permits in the place . The EU has proposed freezing up to 900 million permits to tackle this oversupply . \" There are permits because of the recession ,\" said Isaac Valero , spokesman for EU Climate Commissioner Connie Hedegaard . The price of carbon recovered on Monday after demand for an auction of 3.5 million permits was than expected . A carbon price undermines efforts to reduce C02 emissions . The price of carbon needs to be a deal than 5 euros - some believe between 25 and 30 euros - to provide an incentive for companies to cut emissions and invest in technologies , experts say . The carbon market is to Europe 's efforts to meet its climate change target of a 20 % reduction in C02 emissions from 1990 levels by 2020 .", "The contractor , Smartty 's Management Limited , has been asked to return the payment , the government said . Campaign group Bassetlaw Against Fracking said the drilling operation would be \" \" for wildlife . Nottinghamshire County Council said the application did include proposals for fracturing - known as fracking . IGas has applied to carry out test drilling to check the suitability of the rock for shale gas extraction , through fracking . A application would have to be made to carry out fracking . IGas plans to develop one shale gas , drilling for 14 weeks , and a well , drilling for 19 weeks . During drilling , operations would take place 24 hours a day . The authority said at the project 's peak there would be an average of 18 goods vehicles and 10 vehicles visiting the site each day . David Larder , campaign group chairman , said : \" We object to the 24 hour a day drilling for months . The noise of this operation and the vibration will have a effect upon the wildlife . \" Sally Gill , planning manager for the county council , said : \" If permission is granted , the test drilling would allow IGas to evaluate the resource of shale gas trapped beneath the surface . \" Depending on the results of the test drilling , IGas may , or may , seek permission to extract the shale gas using fracking , but that would require a planning application which would be to consultation . \" Before this stage of the exploration process , the company is required to monitor methane levels in groundwater for 12 months . He did answer asked what those concerns were , but said : \" I am in favour of access under law for all people whatever their sexuality . \"", "Max Schrems wants the court to order the Irish Data Protection Commissioner to audit Facebook to see what material it passes on to the US authorities . The privacy watchdog had said the transfers were protected under the Safe Harbour trade agreement . But a fortnight the European Court of Justice ruled the pact . The ECJ said that as a consequence the regulator was required to examine Mr Schrems' complaint with \" all diligence \" and decide whether to suspend transfers if it believed the firm was providing an \" level of protection \" to protect people 's privacy . Following the ruling , the data commissioner sought guidance from the High Court about it should proceed , resulting in the proceedings . Mr Schrems alleges that whistleblower Edward Snowden 's leaks demonstrate that Facebook - as technology companies - \" aids US spy agencies for mass surveillance \" in breach of the EU 's Charter of Fundamental Rights . Facebook denies providing \" backdoor \" access to the US intelligence agencies and says its data-transfer processes were reviewed by the watchdog as 2012 . The network , whose headquarters is in Dublin , has requested permission to voice its case at the High Court , but has to find out whether it will be permitted to do . \" We believe it is that we join the proceedings so that we can provide information about our procedures and processes , as to correct inaccuracies that exist ,\" a Facebook spokeswoman told the BBC . Mr Schrems has cast doubt on what information the California-based company might provide . \" Facebook is bound by ' gag orders' and is allowed to confirm cooperation with US authorities ,\" he wrote this month . \" Facebook spokespersons [ who comment on the matter ] do have the security clearance to know about programmes themselves . \" The case could set a precedent that influences EU regulators handle complaints about data sent to computer servers for processing and storage . A spokeswoman for the Irish Data Protection Commissioner said it was the High Court would rule on the dispute should proceed .", "The Watford and West Bromwich Albion defender was without a club he joined Blues on a trial deal in September 2012 . He added there was a \" lack of knowledge \" with products .", "The storms over the weekend killed six people , including two Girl Guides who were crushed by a falling tree . Thousands of homes were damaged . Poland 's forester Konrad Tomaszewski said it would take up to two years to clear the fallen trees , and decades for the lost habitat to recover . He called it \" the disaster in the history of Polish - and - forestry \" . It is estimated the storms brought over eight million metres of lumber across 45,000 hectares of forest . Some of the hit areas were Torun , Gdansk , and Poznan - all in the and parts of the country . In Torun , the storms left than 23,000 hectares of damaged forest . It destroyed the habitats of species . In a statement ( in Polish ) , Polish State Forests said they found \" destroyed bird nests \" and \" animals that failed to escape the storm . \" The disaster comes as the government faces criticism for logging in Europe 's forest , which is situated in the east of the country . The Bialowieza forest is a Unesco world heritage site that sits along Poland 's border with Belarus , and is home to wildlife . Unesco , EU officials , and activists have opposed logging and month the European Union 's court ordered that logging operations be stopped . Logging banned in Europe 's forest The government responded by saying logging was to protect the forest from an infestation of bark beetle . The European Court of Justice will meet in a months to determine whether the injunction will remain in place . The European Commission is taking action against Warsaw , and if Poland loses the case it will be for multimillion euro fines .", "Arbroath moved into with a 4-0 victory over Clyde . Subscribe to the BBC Sport newsletter to get our pick of news , features and video sent to your inbox .", "An emission zone in London for the cars will come into force in April 2019 and reports say cities will follow suit . The government will produce a air quality plan by the end of April . But Theresa May has said she will \" take into account \" drivers encouraged to buy diesel cars by governments . Labour Chancellor Gordon Brown introduced a vehicle tax in 2001 to encourage people to buy diesel cars , as they were and thought to be in terms of carbon dioxide emissions . But there has been increasing concern from experts that the vehicles emit levels of nitrogen dioxide , which is thought to have caused thousands of deaths in the UK . The government has to produce a air quality plan after receiving a \" warning \" from the European Commission about breaches of air quality levels in the UK . It lost two court cases in 2015 and 2016 over pollution levels brought by lawyers ClientEarth . To tackle the issue , a \" toxin tax \" is expected to be rolled out across cities , charging drivers of diesel cars up to \u00c2 \u00a3 20 per day to come into areas . Mayor of London Sadiq Khan announced on Tuesday that such a scheme - creating an the emission zone in the capital - would come into force in two years' time , with a charge of \u00c2 \u00a3 12.50 for petrol cars that do meet Euro 4 standards and diesel vehicles that do meet Euro 6 standards . But motoring organisations have said diesel car drivers are being \" punished \" for following a government 's policy . Mrs May has hinted there will be schemes to help drivers who were told that diesel vehicles were the purchase . Speaking on her trip to Jordan and Saudi Arabia , she said : \" Decisions will be taken we produce that [ air quality ] plan . \" But I 'm of the fact that governments have encouraged people to buy diesel cars and we need to take that into account we look at what we do in the future . \" She did set out any plans , but there have been reports of a scrappage scheme that could pay people to get rid of their diesel vehicles .", "McCann is \" \" with the seven faces he has signed in weeks , but admits it has been . \" Identifying guys has been as the club does have any recruitment system behind it ,\" he said . \" It 's something I 'll be speaking to our managing director , John Nelms , about because it 's . \" Facing his season as Dundee boss , McCann says recruitment is \" top of the list of priorities \" for any manager and he is hoping to makes strides in that area of the January transfer window . \" We need help ,\" he added . \" We 've been chasing our tails a bit this time . The US Department of Justice alleged that Mr Clark advised Ulbricht about the way to run the site and to evade the police . The Silk Road website was shut down in 2013 following raids by the FBI and law enforcement agencies . It was a marketplace sited on the web through which people bought drugs . In May this year Ross Ulbricht was sentenced to life in prison for creating and running the site . The DoJ alleges that Mr Clark was a \" \" operator on the Silk Road and was in helping Ulbricht run it . He gave advice about ways to improve the technology underpinning the site , boost sales and on the way for Ulbricht to hide his identity , said US authorities . Mr Clark was paid \" at hundreds of thousands of dollars \" for this advice , said the DoJ in a statement announcing the arrest . \" Clark may have thought residing in Thailand would keep him out of reach of US authorities , but our partnerships have proven him ,\" said FBI assistant director Diego Rodriguez . They say it shows the divergence may have began 360 years . It suggests Travellers are connected to settled people . The researchers found that any disparities between Travellers and settled people in the Republic are to them remaining isolated for centuries and their numbers decreasing . It is thought there are 30,000 people living in the Republic of Ireland who are members of the Travelling community , representing 0.6 % of the population . it had been thought that Travellers had become displaced between 1845 and 1852 as a result of the Great Famine . \" The findings confirm that the Irish Traveller population has an ancestry and this comes at a time the ethnicity of Travellers is being considered by the state ,\" the Royal College of Surgeons' Prof Gianpiero Cavalleri said . \" It is to emphasise that although Travellers show features of a isolate , they are to settled people in Ireland . \" It is to observe that the isolation of Travellers from people predates the Great Famine . \" it 's to emphasise that our research estimates the beginning of the divergence of the Travelling community , than their origin . \" DNA samples from 42 Irish Travellers were compared with that of 143 Roma , 2,232 settled Irish , 2,039 , 5,964 and 931 individuals from the rest of the world for the study . dating methods were used to estimate the period the travelling community began to split from the population in Ireland .", "The stretch of road on the A890 was closed following rock falls month , before it was reopened . But a fundraising campaign launched in September hit its target in a month . Adminstrators Begbies Traynor said the collection will remain on display at the museum in Barlaston , Staffordshire . The Art Fund , which led the campaign , will gift the collection to the Victoria and Albert Museum , before it is loaned to the Wedgwood Museum . Administrator Bob Young said it had been \" \" to sign off on the sale on Monday . \" Today 's outcome would have been without the spirit of goodwill and determination shown during the negotiations ,\" he said . The Wedgwood Museum inherited Waterford Wedgwood plc 's pension bill after the firm collapsed in 2009 . In 2010 the museum went into administration , and in 2011 a court judge ruled its collection could be sold to reimburse the Pension Protection Fund . Alison Wedgwood , whose husband Tom is a descendant of company founder Josiah Wedgwood , said the collection was \" \" for Staffordshire . The collection risked being \" sold and scattered around the globe \" had the money been raised , she added . Its importance as an oil exporting nation has made interdependence with the West - the consumer demand is found - a necessity . This , in turn , has led to and relationships that at times have been a source of awkwardness for both sides . It stands out for its espousal of a version of Sunni Islam , including punishments as beheadings , and its restrictions on women . Population 28.7 million Area 2.24 million sq km ( 864,869 sq miles ) language religion Islam Life expectancy 73 years ( men ) , 76 years ( women ) Currency Riyal Head of state , minister : King Salman bin Abdulaziz al-Saud The Al Saud dynasty holds a monopoly of power . Saudi Arabia was established in 1932 by King Abd-al-Aziz and he has been succeeded by sons . King Salman bin Abdulaziz al-Saud ascended the throne in January 2015 following the death of his half-brother , King Abdullah . He has been part of the ruling clique of princes for decades and is thought to continue the thrusts of policy , including maintaining the alliance with the United States and working towards energy market stability . investors are players in the TV industry , but the country has one of the region 's media environments . The government acknowledges that internet filtering takes place . It targets \" \" , , rights and sites . Saudi Arabia has the YouTube use of any country in the world . It is home to than 40 % of all Twitter users in the region . Some events in Saudi Arabia 's history : 1932 - The areas controlled by King Abd-al-Aziz are unified under the name Kingdom of Saudi Arabia . 1938 - Oil is discovered and production begins under the Aramco ( Arabian American Oil Company ) . 1960 - Saudi Arabia is a founding member of Opec ( Organisation of Petroleum Exporting Countries ) . 1973 - Saudi Arabia leads an oil boycott against the countries that supported Israel in the October War against Egypt and Syria . Oil prices quadruple . 2001 11 September - 15 of the 19 hijackers involved in attacks on New York and Washington are nationals . 2011 - As '' Arab Spring '' protests ripple across the region , troops participate in crackdown on unrest in Bahrain . 2015 March - Saudi Arabia launches campaign of air strikes against rebels in Yemen .", "The NSPCC 's Childline service said it counselled than 4,500 children in the year compared to 2,400 in 2011-12 . Pat Masterson , who lives in Lisnarick , photographed the swans before they were killed on Tuesday evening . \" I saw their mother walking them along the road , all in line , I stopped to take a picture ,\" said Ms Masterson . \" They 've visited our farm every day over the weeks so I 've photographed them , but I thought that the way the wee cygnets were following their mother was I had to stop and watch . \" I ca believe that they were run over . \" vet Kevin Leonard , who happened to be passing moments after the birds were killed , said he was by what he saw . \" The five of them were lying in a row behind the mother , who was injured . \" Four of them were and the was mangled I had to put it down with an injection . \" The one had injuries , I gave it an cream and guided it into a field alongside its mother . \" It was quite an sight . He said he was \" \" by what he saw . \" A girl who was said she saw the car running them down and driving . \" We 're all wondering this could have been an accident - it 's a 30mph speed limit and it was so the swans were . \" If you ca see six swans on the road , what are the chances you 'll see a child ? As birds , swans enjoy protection under the Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 and it is an offence to injure , take or kill a swan . The act protects the eggs and nests of swans . It is an offence to take or possess the egg of a mute swan , or to damage or destroy the nest of a swan whilst in use or being built . The RSPB said anyone who witnesses an offence against swans or wildlife should contact their police Wildlife Liaison Officer through their police station .", "In May , Punch Taverns halted its plans for The Corn Exchange , in Crickhowell , after protests which led to villagers launching their bid to buy it . The rise was among men who have sex with men . At the time , rates of warts decreased , thanks to a vaccination campaign . Rates of transmitted infections as a group went , totalling 434,456 . Chlamydia was the diagnosed STI , accounting for half of the cases diagnosed in 2015 . people are offered chlamydia screening , but 13 % of men and 32 % of women were tested in 2015 . The company has announced a \u00c2 \u00a3 600m investment in a computer system . But it says government support is needed to improve the network of \" ageing \" flightpaths . Paul Peers , head of development at Nats Prestwick , said : \" We are predicted to have the amount of traffic we have had for a summer period this year . \" We are expecting to have around 15,000 flights in July and August compared to year . \" We are for that and our controllers have been doing a job up to this point making that we minimise the delays that people see and making that we keep people in the skies . \" We have been preparing for this since November , so the summer does come as a surprise to us , and we have a series of events to make our controllers are for the summer traffic . \" , this year , the build-up in traffic has helped us with that because we 've had record days that our controllers have dealt with . \" But one of the challenges for us is the design of the airspace in the future and the traffic growth . \" He added : \" We are investing over \u00c2 \u00a3 600m over the years in the technology systems . \" In fact , at the Prestwick centre we are to say that we have the version of iTec , our flight data processing system , in operation and that is the in the UK . \" The skies are getting every year and we are expecting to see increased traffic growth . \" But if you think about the airspace as motorways in the sky , if you think about 1970s motorways with today 's car traffic , we are in a scenario . \" We are going to have to redesign our airspace and we are going to need government support to make we can do that in the way . \"", "It follows 55,000 job cuts announced this year . The losses will come in Hewlett Packard Enterprise ( HPE ) , which is splitting from the printer and PC business . The company says the cuts will save $ 2.7bn ( \u00c2 \u00a3 1.76bn ) in costs , although the plan will cost $ 2.7bn to carry out . At a meeting for Wall Street analysts , chairman and executive Meg Whitman said : \" We 've done a amount of work over the years to take costs out and simplify processes and these actions will eliminate the need for any restructuring . \" The structure proposed by Ms Whitman sees HP Enterprise focusing on businesses and government agencies , and the PC and printing divisions on the consumer market . The company has than 300,000 employees . \" The number is than some people might have expected , but I think it 's a reflection of trouble HP has been having with its services ,\" said Charles King , analyst at the Silicon Valley IT consulting firm Pund-IT . \" I 'm if HP is finished with the layoffs . \" The company will say the cuts will fall , but part of the plan involves changing the nature of the workforce . The proportion of workers in what HPE calls \" locations \" is expected to rise from around 42 % to 60 % by 2018 . The tech company has struggled over the decade to keep up with changing demands as customers move from desktop computers . , Hewlett-Packard is one of the world 's technology companies , with revenues this year expected to top $ 50bn . The company started life in a Palo Alto garage in California in 1939 and grew to be the guiding light of what became known as Silicon Valley . Its fortunes started to decline with a series of and criticised acquisitions including Compaq for $ 25bn in 2002 , consultants EDS for $ 14bn in 2008 and Autonomy for $ 11bn in 2011 . In 2012 it lost its position as the world 's leading supplier of PCs to Lenovo . The share price peaked at the height of the dot.com boom in 2000 , and , despite two surges in 2007 and 2010 , it has lost some 60 % of its value since .", "Yorkshire Ambulance Service ( YAS ) figures show medics spent 32,000 hours waiting at A & E departments in 2015-16 compared with 16,000 in 2014-15 . Dr David Macklin , Executive Director of Operations at YAS , said handover waiting times were \" a system problem \" for the NHS , in Yorkshire , and said blame could be attached to hospitals . \" We have occasions we have vehicles queued at hospitals ,\" he said . \" Emergency departments across Yorkshire are working to manage their demand and that means ambulances are queuing . \" Patients who are injured may need to wait . \" Professor Keith Willett from NHS England said the increase in waiting times was \" \" and added there were \" a multitude of reasons \" for the rise . \" One of the problems is the pressure on the beds in the hospital ,\" he said . \" That 's because the hospitals are finding it to move patients and their care into the community . \" The figures were supplied after a Freedom of Information request by the BBC . five hospitals - one each in East , South and West Yorkshire and two in North Yorkshire - accounted for 70 % of the waiting time . A post-mortem examination was carried out on Monday , the cause of death was given as a gunshot wound to the head .", "He died at his home in Cambridge following an illness lasting months , a statement on his website said . It added his funeral will be , with a service to be held at a date . Hogwood worked with leading orchestras around the world and was considered one of the exponents of the movement . The conductor founded the Academy of Ancient Music ( AAM ) in 1973 and directed the academy across six continents for some 30 years . The AAM made than 200 CDs , including the cycle of Mozart symphonies on period instruments . Among his recordings include the 1980 version of Handel 's Messiah with Emma Kirkby and Carolyn Watkinson , which was named by BBC Music Magazine as one of the 20 recordings of all time . Hogwood studied keyboard at Cambridge University with Rafael Puyana and Mary Potts and with Zuzana Ruzickova and Gustav Leonhardt . His positions were as a keyboard player and musicologist with the Academy of Saint Martin-in-the-Fields under Sir Neville Marriner , and was a founder member of the Early Music Consort of London . He was the director of the King 's Lynn Festival and Boston 's Handel and Haydn Society . He was a tutor at Harvard University , professor of music at the University of Cambridge and a professor-at-large at Cornell University in the US . \" Christopher had generosity of spirit ,\" Christopher Purvis , president of the AAM , said . \" He was a ambassador for informed music , the movement of which he was a founder . And he was to see the orchestra he founded develop and grow after he stepped down as director . \" The AAM 's music director Richard Egarr added : \" I am saddened by the news of Christopher 's passing . Christopher provided a legacy for me to build upon I joined in 2006 and I know he will be missed by all who knew and worked with him . \" Speaking to Sean Rafferty on Radio 3 's In Tune , soprano Dame Emma Kirkby said : \" Some of the players that lead orchestras over the world , they started with him . \" Chris was a academic , an man . He had an capacity to absorb information of all kinds and a sense of things would be if he tried to reproduce conditions ... a person . \" David Thomas from Trinity Laban Conservatoire of Music and Dance , London added : \" He said I want the music to speak for itself because it can , it 's , it will\u00e2 \u20ac\u00a6 a and man . \"", "Dana was transported to the Al-Mawa reserve via Turkey along with four lions , two bears and two tigers in a operation organised by the animal welfare charity Four Paws . The site is known as Two Women Sitting Down and is at Bootu Creek , north of Tennant Creek . OM Manganese was fined A $ 150,000 ($ 134,000 ; \u00c2 \u00a3 88,000 ) . Peter Toth , CEO of OM Holdings , which owns OM Manganese , said : \" The company intended to harm , damage or disrespect the site . \" \" We regret the damage and the hurt caused and I apologise to the site 's custodians and owners ,\" he said . Two Women Sitting Down is associated with Australia 's Kunapa people . OM Manganese was accused of causing the collapse of part of the site , including a outcrop known as the Horse 's Head , in July 2011 . Prosecutors told the Darwin Magistrates Court that the company performed explosive blasting to the site to break up ground , broadcaster ABC reported . The company was permitted to mine in the area , but was advised to steer of sites , and was warned in 2011 that cracks were appearing in rocks at the Bootu Creek site , the broadcaster said . Dr Ben Scambary , officer of the Aboriginal Areas Protection Authority , said that the site was of significance to Australia 's people . \" This site ... relates to a dreaming story about a rat and a bandicoot who had a fight over bush tucker [ bush food ],\" he said . \" As the creation ancestors fought , their blood spilled out , turning the rock a colour that is associated with manganese . \" Kunapa community representative Gina Smith said : \" It will remain a site to us , but it has been ruined and we do know what to do because this has happened to the people . \" It has been for thousands of years as part of our culture and our story . \" Australians believe the land is the mother of creation , and is a living , breathing mass of secrets and wisdom , the BBC 's Phil Mercer in Sydney reports .", "K Prithika Yashini , who was born but underwent gender reassignment surgery , applied to become a police sub-inspector in the state .
